module.name: hal_base_driver
module.details: This abstract class is the common ancestor of all HAL stateful HAL drivers.

config.name: HAL_USE_MUTUAL_EXCLUSION
config.brief: Enables the mutual exclusion APIs on driver instances.
config.note: Disabling this option saves both code and data space.

config.name: HAL_USE_REGISTRY
config.brief: Enables the HAL registry for drivers.
config.note: Disabling this option saves both code and data space.

typedef.name: driver_state_t
typedef.brief: Type of a driver state variable.

typedef.name: hal_regent_t
typedef.brief: Type of a registry entry structure.

field.name: next
field.brief: Next entry in the drivers registry.

field.name: prev
field.brief: Previous entry in the drivers registry.

class.name: hal_base_driver
class.brief: Ancestor class of stateful HAL drivers.

method.name: __drv_do_configure
method.retval: If the configuration has been rejected.

method.name: drvStart
method.details: Starts driver operations, on the 1st call the peripheral is physically initialized using a default configuration, subsequent calls are ignored.
method.note: The function can fail with error @p HAL_RET_INV_STATE if called while the driver is already being started or stopped. In case you need multiple threads to perform start and stop operation on the driver then it is suggested to lock/unlock the driver during such operations.
method.retval: If the driver was in one of @p HAL_DRV_STATE_UNINIT, @p HAL_DRV_STATE_STARTING or @p HAL_DRV_STATE_STOPPING states.
If a required resources cannot be allocated.
If a required HW resource is already in use.

method.name: drvStop
method.details: Stops driver operations. The peripheral is physically uninitialized.

method.name: drvConfigureX
method.details: Applies a new configuration to the driver. The configuration structure is architecture-dependent.
method.note: Applying a configuration should be done while the peripheral is not actively operating, this function can fail depending on the driver implementation and current state.

method.name: drvSetNameX
method.note: Does nothing if registry is disabled.

variable.name: hal_registry
variable.brief: List header for the HAL registry

function.name: drvInit
drvRegGetFirstX
function.brief: Return the first driver in the HAL registry.
function.return: A pointer to the first driver object.

function.name: drvRegGetNextX
function.brief: Return the next driver in the HAL registry.
function.note: This function is only available when HAL registry is enabled.
function.return: A pointer to the next driver object.
function.retval: If there is no next driver.

function.name: drvStartByName
function.details: Returns a reference to the driver, on the 1st open the peripheral is physically initialized. An implementation-dependent default configuration is used for initialization.
function.note: This function is only available when HAL registry is enabled.
function.param: Pointer to store the error code or @p NULL. Note that in case of driver not found the returned code is @p HAL_RET_SUCCESS.

function.name: drv_reg_insert
function.brief: Driver insertion in the HAL registry.
function.note: This function is only available when HAL registry is enabled.
function.param: Pointer to the @p hal_base_driver_c instance to be inserted.

function.name: drv_reg_remove
function.brief: Driver removal from the HAL registry.
function.param: Pointer to the @p hal_base_driver_c instance to be inserted.
